propertyGroup.name: Outlets
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: value-objects
property.documentation: When using the CRUD feature (manageable entities) this outlet will be used to emit the value objects to (returned by the services to the client).

property.name: criteria
property.documentation: The location to which search criteria classes are being generated. If you do not specify this outlet criteria classes will be generated to the daos outlet.

property.name: services
property.documentation: The location to which all service classes (including the service locator(s)) will be generated.

property.name: service-impls
property.documentation: The location to which all service implementation classes will be generated.

property.name: service-interfaces
property.documentation: The location to which all service interfaces and common API classes such as default service exceptions will be generated.

property.name: daos
property.documentation:
The location to which Spring DAOs, and any support classes.
Please NOTE that the dao implementation classes will also be generated to this location when no operations are present on the entity with classifier scope.

property.name: dao-impls
property.documentation:
The location to which Spring DAO implementation classes will be generated (if there are any classifier scoped business operations modeled on any entity).
Please NOTE that the dao implementation classes will be generated to the daos outlet when no operations are present on the entity with classifier scope.

property.name: spring-configuration
property.documentation: The location to which the Spring applicationContext.xml will be generated.

property.name: open-session-in-view
property.documentation: The location to which the AndroMDA OpenSessionInViewFilter will be generated (allows the Hibernate open-session-in-view pattern when you want to expose your enties directly to your presentation tier - allows lazy-loading to occur that level).

property.name: session-ejbs
property.documentation: The outlet to which EJB support is generated. If undefined, EJB support will not be generated. Note: the EJB interfaces can be seperated from beans with session-ejb-interfaces.

property.name: session-ejb-interfaces
property.documentation: The outlet to which EJB interfaces are generated (home and remote). If undefined, EJB interfaces will be generated into session-ejbs outlet.

property.name: advice-impls
property.documentation: The location to which any advice implementation classes will be generated. Currently this is useful when using the cartridge's remoting support.

property.name: client
property.documentation: The location where client side code is generated if using Spring remoting.

property.name: client-config
property.documentation: The location where client side configuration files are generated if using Spring remoting.

property.name: client-test
property.documentation: The location where client side test implementation code will be generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

property.name: server
property.documentation: The location where server side code is generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

property.name: server-impl
property.documentation: The location where server side implementation code will be generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

property.name: server-config
property.documentation: The location where server side configuration code is generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

property.name: server-test
property.documentation: The location where server side test implementation code will be generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

property.name: server-test-config
property.documentation: The location where server side test configuration files will be generated if using a Rich Client environment (i.e. the richClient namespace entry is "true").

property.name: merge-mappings
property.documentation: The location where AndroMDA merge mapping stub files should be generated.

property.name: remoting-war-support
property.documentation: The location where any remoting support files to be bundled in the war used to expose the remote services will be generated.

property.name: osgi
property.documentation: The location to which OSGi related files (e.g. the Spring applicationContext-osgi-export.xml) will be generated.

property.name: springVersion
property.documentation:
The version of Spring to use/support when generating. Neccessary when api changes make some classes and/or methods deprecated.
Permitted values are:
2.0
2.5

property.name: webServiceOutgoingAttachmentHandlerCallPattern
property.documentation:
The pattern to use when constructing the call to the attachment handler (used for sending outgoing attachments when your service also represents a web service), for example:
Axis: org.andromda.webservice.AxisAttachmentHandler.saveAttachment(content, contentType, dime)
Attachments are good for sending large amounts of data over over the wire as it doesn't embed the data directly in the XML. NOTE: the handler call must have three parameters named content, contentType and dime.

property.name: webServiceIncomingAttachmentHandlerCallPattern
property.documentation:
The pattern to use when constructing the call to the attachment handler (used for retrieving incoming attachments when your service also represents a web service), for example:
Axis: org.andromda.webservice.AxisAttachmentHandler.getAttachments()
Attachments are good for sending large amounts of data over over the wire as it doesn't embed the data directly in the XML.

property.name: daoInheritanceEnabled
property.documentation: Whether or not the DAOs should make up an inheritance tree in the same way as their respective entities. This is enabled by default but you might want to disable it if you prefer not to have top-level DAO operations visible in child DAO classes, this is usually the case when using JDK5 generics, which can be enabled using the enableTemplating namespace property.

property.name: enableDaoPropertiesCreateMethod
property.documentation: Whether or not the create methods on the DAOs taking properties from the entity shall be generated.

property.name: messageBundlePath
property.documentation: The path of the file representing the message bundle.

property.name: messageSourceBeanName
property.documentation: The name of the bean that stores the message source.

property.name: daoNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Dao all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Dao".

property.name: daoBaseNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the base DAO's name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}DaoBase all the entities generated would have a suffix of "DaoBase".

property.name: daoImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the DAO's implementation name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}DaoImpl all the entities generated would have a suffix of "DaoImpl".

property.name: ejbJndiNamePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix to give to the Session EJB JNDI names (this allows the same Session EJB to be deployed multiple times in the same container)

property.name: enableSpringTransactionsWhenEjbsEnabled
property.documentation: Whether or not to enable Spring transaction support when EJBs are enabled. If this is set to false then only EJB transaction support is generated.

property.name: ejbTransactionsEnabled
property.documentation: Whether or not EJB transactions should be enabled. This is sometimes useful to turn off when you're using EJB wrapped spring services but want to turn off EJB transaction management so that Spring alone handles the transactions (note that this property only make sense when EJBs are enabled).

property.name: ejbRemoteProxyFactoryBean
property.documentation: Full class name for proxy factory bean used in application context for remote EJB access applicationContextRemoteEjb.

property.name: ejbLocalProxyFactoryBean
property.documentation: Full class name for proxy factory bean used in application context for local EJB access applicationContextLocalEjb.

property.name: ejbRemoteProviderUrl
property.documentation: The provider URL for remote EJB access.

property.name: ejbRemoteInitialContextFactory
property.documentation: The initial context factory class for remote EJB access.

property.name: ejbRemoteUrlPackagePrefixes
property.documentation: The URL package prefixes for remote EJB access.

property.name: ejbPackageNamePattern
property.documentation: If EJBs are being used, this specifies the pattern to be used when constructing the EJB package name (this allows a Spring Service to be wrapped by a Session EJB and avoids name conflicts). The {0} character represents the service package name. This could be something like {0}.ejb which would create the Spring Session EJBs in the package ending in the ejb package.

property.name: implementationPackageNamePattern
property.documentation: This specifies the pattern to be used for the package name of the spring service implementation class. You can use this to place the implementation class in a different package than the interface (e.g. in a OSGi runtime). The default {0} character represents the service package name.

property.name: defaultServiceExceptionNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the default service exception name. NOTE: This propety is only applicable when defaultServiceExceptions is true.

property.name: defaultServiceExceptions
property.documentation: Whether or not to generate a default exception for each service. This exception will handle unexpected exceptions occuring within the implemented operations.

property.name: serviceInterceptors
property.documentation: Sets a list of default additional interceptors to be applied to service ProxyBeanFactory declarations. They will be listed after the serviceSecurityInterceptor, serviceTransactionInterceptor and hibernateInterceptor if present.

property.name: externalPrincipalStoreClass
property.documentation: If this is present, it will be assumed that an external principal store class will be used and non will be generated.

property.name: externalPrincipalStoreGetter
property.documentation: If externalPrincipalStoreClass is defined, externalPrincipalStoreGetter defines the method call on that class that will retrieve the principal.

property.name: externalPrincipalStoreGetterType
property.documentation: If externalPrincipalStoreClass is defined, externalPrincipalStoreGetterType defines the type returned by the externalPrincipalStoreGetter method.

property.name: entityNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Entity all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Entity".

property.name: serviceOperationTransactionType
property.documentation: The default transaction type used for service operations (when not wrapping your services with EJBs). NOTE: Can be overridden on a per entity basis with the @andromda.spring.transaction.type tagged value.

property.name: ejbServiceOperationTransactionType
property.documentation:
The default transaction type definition used if EJB service operations.
Permitted values are:
NotSupported
Supports
Required
RequiresNew
Mandatory
Never

property.name: ejbViewType
ejbSessionBeanBaseInterfaceLocal
property.documentation: Name of session bean local base interface for ejb wrapper.

property.name: ejbSessionBeanBaseInterfaceRemote
property.documentation: Name of session bean remote base interface for ejb wrapper.

property.name: ejbSessionBeanBaseClass
property.documentation: Full name of session bean base class for ejb wrapper.

property.name: implementationOperationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern used to the create the implementation operation name (i.e. the operations that actually perform the handling of the logic), where {0} represents the operation name

property.name: driver
property.documentation: JDBC Driver to make a database connection.

property.name: username
property.documentation: The database user login name.

property.name: password
property.documentation: The database user password.

property.name: connectionUrl
property.documentation: URL for the JDBC Driver to make the connection to the database.

property.name: dataSource
property.documentation: JNDI name of data source to use. (would be used instead of the connection properties, driver, username, password, etc).

property.name: applicationContext
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring application context file.

property.name: applicationContextManageable
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring CRUD application context file.

property.name: applicationContextDataSource
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring datasource application context file

property.name: applicationContextLocalDataSource
property.documentation: The name given to the Spring local datasource application context file

property.name: applicationContextServer
property.documentation: The name given to the server side Spring configuration file used to export services for remote invocation.

property.name: applicationContextClient
property.documentation: The name given to the client side Spring configuration file used to import services invoked remotely.

property.name: applicationContextRemoteEjb
property.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the bean proxy definitions for accessing the ejb service wrappers (if generated with ejbViewType='remote' or 'both') via remote ejb interfaces (i.e. some/path/applicationContext-remoteejb.xml).

property.name: applicationContextLocalEjb
property.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the bean proxy definitions for accessing the ejb service wrappers (if generated with ejbViewType='local' or 'both') via local ejb interfaces (i.e. some/path/applicationContext-localejb.xml)

property.name: applicationContextOsgiExport
property.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the spring osgi export definitions for all defined services.

property.name: applicationContextOsgiImport
property.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the spring osgi import definitions for all defined services.

property.name: beanRefFactory
property.documentation: The name/path of the bean ref factory resource file (i.e. some/path/beanRefFactory.xml)

property.name: beanRefFactoryId
property.documentation: The ID for the Spring bean reference factory (used to load the bean factory).

property.name: beanRefFactoryEjbId
property.documentation: The ID for the Spring bean reference factory that holds the EJB references.

property.name: beanNamePrefix
property.documentation: The name prefix for all spring bean ids.

property.name: transactionManager
property.documentation: The transaction manager implementation used by Spring.

property.name: dataSourceEnabled
property.documentation: Whether or not a data source will be defined. By default the data source configuration is always generated, however if this is set to false and no entities have been modeled, a data source will not be generated.

property.name: localTransactionManager
property.documentation: The transaction manager implementation used by Spring for the local datasource (applicationContextLocalDataSource).

property.name: userTransactionName
property.documentation: The (JNDI-) user transaction manager of the J2EE container if using JTA transactions (via spring).

property.name: transactionManagerName
property.documentation: The (JNDI-) transaction manager of the J2EE container if using JTA transactions (via spring).

property.name: sessionFactory
property.documentation: Factory bean that creates a local Hibernate SessionFactory instance within Spring.

property.name: springTypesPackage
property.documentation: The package to which extra types are generated (i.e. ServiceLocator).

property.name: springCommonTypesPackage
property.documentation: Optional definition of the package name where all common visible (to the client) extra types are to be generated (e.g. PaginationResult).

property.name: springPresentationTypesPackage
property.documentation: The package to which extra presentation types are generated (i.e. OpenSessionInViewFilter).

property.name: serviceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the service locator class.

property.name: serviceLocatorDefaultFactoryId
property.documentation: The default beanReafFactoryId to be used in the ServiceLocator. By default the beanRefFactoryId is used (if EJB is not activated). If EJB is activated the beanRefFactoryEjbId is used. With the serviceLocatorDefaultFactoryId this behaviour can be explicit overridden.

property.name: manageableServiceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the CRUD service locator class.

property.name: clientServiceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give the service locator class used by remote clients.

property.name: clientServiceLocatorClassloaderSwitching
property.documentation: Whether the client service locator should switch the thread context class loader during retrieval of the client application context xml file.

property.name: clientExceptionHandlingAdviceName
property.documentation: The name for the client side exception handling advice

property.name: criteriaSearchBaseName
property.documentation: The base name for the hibernate criteria search utility classes.

property.name: principalStoreName
property.documentation: The name of the principal store class.

property.name: openSessionInViewFilterName
property.documentation: The name of the OpenSessionInViewFilter (when using the open-session-in-view pattern).

property.name: securityRealm
property.documentation: The name of the security realm (i.e. animal-quiz, other, etc). NOTE:This enables EJB security if specified.

property.name: jndiDataSourceClass
property.documentation: The name of the class to use when using a JNDI data source for data access.

property.name: jndiDataSourceCaching
property.documentation: Enables to turn off the caching of the jndi datasource (value false) if using the default data source class org.springframework.jndi.JndiObjectFactoryBean. Usefull for allowing hot redeployment of JNDI objects. If not specified, no additional code is generated with default behaviour cache enabled.

property.name: jdbcDataSourceClass
property.documentation: The name of the class to use when using a JDBC data source for data access.

property.name: jdbcDataSourceDestroyMethod
property.documentation: The name of the method to use for destroying the JDBC datasource.

property.name: parameterRequiredCheck
property.documentation: Whether or not parameters should be checked if they're required (on DAOs and services)

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.documentation: The encoding for xml documents

property.name: crudValueObjectSuffix
property.documentation: The suffix to append to the names of generated value objects used in CRUD (manageable entities).

property.name: implementationLanguage
property.documentation: Indicates the programming language being used in classes generated to be completed by hand (service and dao implementation,for example).

propertyGroup.name: JMS
propertyGroup.documentation: The properties for configuring JMS support generation. JMS support is only available whtn using Spring 2.x.

property.name: jmsProviderUrl
property.documentation: The provider URL for remote JMS access (if you're using ActiveMQ as your provider, you'll typically want to set the URL as something like 'reliable:tcp://localhost:61616'; changing the port as necessary of course).

property.name: jmsInitialContextFactory
property.documentation: The initial context factory class for JMS access.

property.name: jmsUrlPackagePrefixes
property.documentation: The URL package prefixes for remote JMS access.

property.name: jmsConnectionFactory
property.documentation: The default JMS queue connection factory.

property.name: applicationContextJms
property.documentation: The name/path of the application context resource file that contains the bean proxy definitions for accessing the JMS related services (i.e. Queues).

property.name: jmsTopicNamePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix for topics names (i.e. a prefix of "topic/" would result in a topic named "Events" as "topic/Events"). Applies to the JNDI name (in case of JBossMQ), or physical name (in case of ActiveMQ).

property.name: jmsQueueNamePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix for queue names (i.e. a prefix of "queue/" would result in a topic named "Events" as "queue/Events"). Applies to the JNDI name (in case of JBossMQ), or physical name (in case of ActiveMQ).

property.name: jmsTemplateImplementation
property.documentation: The implementation to use for the Spring JmsTemplate. org.springframework.jms.core.JmsTemplate102 is used for JMS 1.0.2 providers and org.springframework.jms.core.JmsTemplate is used for 1.1 providers.

property.name: jmsReceiveTimeout
property.documentation: The timeout at which the transmission of the JMS message will timeout.

property.name: jmsDestinationTemplatePattern
property.documentation: The pattern used to create the JMS template used for accessing a destination (topic/queue).

property.name: jmsProvider
property.documentation: The JMS provider implementation (valid values are "JBossMQ" and "ActiveMQ")

property.name: jmsMessageListenerAdapterImplementation
property.documentation: The Spring message listener adaptor implementation. See API docs.

property.name: jmsMessageListenerContainerImplementation
property.documentation: The Spring message listener container implementation. See API docs.

property.name: jmsExplicitQosEnabled
property.documentation: If "true", then the values of deliveryMode, priority, and timeToLive will be used when sending a message.

property.name: jmsClientId
property.documentation: Set the client identifier base name for JMS connections.

property.name: jmsDurableSubscriptions
property.documentation: Whether or not subscriptions should be durable by default. Only makes sense when listening to a topic (pub-sub domain).

property.name: jmsDurableSubscriptionName
property.documentation: The name used to identify the durable subscription. To be applied in case of a topic (pub-sub domain) with subscription durability activated. The durable subscription name needs to be unique within this client's JMS client id. Default is the class name of the specified message listener.

property.name: jmsTransactionsEnabled
property.documentation: Whether or not JMS destinations should be transacted.

property.name: jmsCacheLevelName
property.documentation: Sets the cache level name. See setCacheLevelName(java.lang.String)

property.name: jmsMaxIncomingMessagesPerReceive
property.documentation: Sets the maxmium number of incoming messages to process at a time per receive.

property.name: jmsRecoveryInterval
property.documentation: The interval of recovery attempts in milliseconds.

property.name: jmsSessionTransacted
property.documentation: Set the transaction mode that is used when creating a JMS Session. See setSessionTransacted(boolean)

property.name: jmsActiveMqDurableTopicPrefetch
property.documentation: Sets the default durable topic prefetch policy for ActiveMQ.

property.name: jmsActiveMqQueuePrefetch
property.documentation: Sets the default queue prefetch policy for ActiveMQ.

property.name: manageableSearchMatchMode
property.documentation:
Specifies the match mode to be used in CRUD searches.
Valid values are (string):
start Start of the word
anywhere Anywhere in the word

propertyGroup.name: Hibernate
propertyGroup.documentation: The properties for configuring Hibernate support generation.

property.name: hibernateVersion
property.documentation:
The version of Hibernate to use when generating.
Allowable values are:
2
3

property.name: hibernateMappingStrategy
property.documentation:
Denotes whether or not subclasses should be mapped into the same .hbm.xml file or in a separate one.
Set this value to subclass when you want to have a mapping file per entity
The default is hierarchy which will render a mapping file per subclass
This information is important for the Spring cartridge because it needs to know which entities require a mapping file and which don't.

property.name: hibernateXMLPersistence
property.documentation: Set to TRUE to enable Hibernate's XML persistence support using dom4J. "hibernateVersion" must be set to "3"

property.name: hibernateQueryUseNamedParameters
property.documentation: Whether or not named parameters (i.e. ':someParameter') or unnamed (i.e. '?') parameters should be used in the HQL queries embedded within the model. NOTE: Does not apply to queries written in OCL.

property.name: hibernateInheritanceStrategy
property.documentation:
Defines the hibernate inheritance strategy (unless overridden on an entity level by the @andromda.hibernate.inheritance tagged value, can be the following possible values:
class - table per hierarchy.
subclass - table per class in hierarchy.
concrete - Table per class.
interface - Root class is defined as an interface and the attributes remapped to the subclasses. This is useful in the concrete case because it has limitations in the associations.

property.name: serviceHibernateInterceptorEnabled
property.documentation: Whether or not the hibernate interceptor should be enabled on services.

property.name: hibernatePoolSize
property.documentation: Hibernate connection pool size.

property.name: hibernateTransactionManagerStrategy
property.documentation: Strategy for obtaining the JTA TransactionManager

property.name: hibernateUserTransactionName
property.documentation: The JNDI name of the JTA UserTransaction object

property.name: hibernateTransactionManagerLookup
property.documentation: The fully qualified class name of the Hibernate TransactionFactory implementation

property.name: hibernateTransactionFactoryClass
property.documentation: The name of the hibernate transaction factory class to use.

property.name: hibernateUseOuterJoin
property.documentation: Whether or not to use outer joins.

property.name: hibernateShowSql
property.documentation: Whether or not to log SQL statements (true/false). By default this is off (within Hibernate).

property.name: hibernateJndiName
property.documentation: JNDI name bound to the SessionFactory.

property.name: hibernateDialect
property.documentation: SQL dialect of the database being used.

property.name: hibernateDefaultSchema
property.documentation: Qualify unqualified tablenames with the given schema/tablespace in generated SQL.

property.name: hibernateMaxFetchDepth
property.documentation: Sets a maximum "depth" for the outer join fetch tree. eg. recommended values between 0 and 3

property.name: hibernateJdbcFetchSize
property.documentation: A non-zero value determines the JDBC fetch size.

property.name: hibernateDefaultBatchFetchSize
property.documentation: hibernate.default_batch_fetch_size Set a default size for Hibernate batch fetching of associations. Recommended values: 4, 8, 16

property.name: hibernateJdbcBatchSize
property.documentation: A nonzero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. ex: recommended values between 5 and 30

property.name: hibernateJdbcUseScrollableResultSet
property.documentation: Whether or not to enable use of JDBC2 scrollable resultsets by Hibernate. This property is only necessary when using user supplied connections. Hibernate uses connection metadata otherwise.

property.name: hibernateJdbcUseStreamsForBinary
property.documentation: Whether or not to use streams when writing / reading binary or serializable types to/from JDBC

property.name: hibernateHbm2DDLAuto
property.documentation:
Automatically export schema DDL to the database when the SessionFactory is created. With create-drop, the database schema will be dropped when the SessionFactory is closed explicitely. Permitted values are:
update
create
create-drop

property.name: hibernateQuerySubstitutions
property.documentation: Allows you to define new Hibernate query tokens. For example: giving this a value of true=1, false=0 would cause the tokens true and false to be translated to integer literals in the generated SQL.

property.name: hibernateEnableCache
property.documentation:
Enable/disable hibernate's second level cache features when using Hibernate.
true
false

property.name: hibernateCacheProvider
property.documentation: Defines the Hibernate cache provider implementation class.

property.name: hibernateQueryCacheFactory
property.documentation: Defines Hibernate query cache factory implementation class

property.name: hibernateConnectionReleaseMode
property.documentation:
Specify when Hibernate should release JDBC connections. By default, a JDBC connection is held until the session is explicitly closed or disconnected. For an application server JTA datasource, you should use after_statement to aggressively release connections after every JDBC call. For a non-JTA connection, it often makes sense to release the connection at the end of each transaction, by using after_transaction. auto will choose after_statement for the JTA and CMT transaction strategies and after_transaction for the JDBC transaction strategy.
Valid values are:
on_close - default
after_transaction
after_statement
auto

property.name: javaTypeConversionIgnoreList
property.documentation: A list of one or more fully qualified java types that should be ignored whenever a type conversion needs to be done. Currently, there is an issue with ValueObjects generated with the Java Axis mappings that causes Spring cartidge to generate DAO "entity to value object" type conversions incorrectly for all date types. By listing those date types here, the Spring cartridge will not attempt to auto-generate conversions for date/time related attributes.

property.name: hibernateInterceptorFlushMode
property.documentation:
Specifies the FLUSH_MODE for the Hibernate Interceptor (org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateInterceptor). FLUSH_MODE determines the moment where all the generated SQL from a transaction should be flushed to the database.
Valid values are (integer):
0 FLUSH_NEVER
1 FLUSH_AUTO - default
2 FLUSH_EAGER
3 FLUSH_COMMIT

propertyGroup.name: Acegi Security
propertyGroup.documentation: Configures the declaritive role based security without EJB, which uses the Acegi Security System for Spring.

property.name: acegiServiceSecurity
property.documentation: Whether or not acegi security framework should be used for role based recurity handling for spring services.

property.name: acegiServiceSecurityInterceptor
property.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security interception.

property.name: acegiServiceAccessDecisionManager
property.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security access decision manager.

property.name: acegiServiceDecisionVoter
property.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security access decision voter.

property.name: acegiRemoteAuthenticationManagerServiceInterface
property.documentation: The name of the class to use for the acegi security remote authentication manager (in the client remote context).

property.name: acegiRolePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix for all roles defined in the model. This configures the acegiServiceDecisionVoters rolePrefix attribute. As proposed by Acegi for our default voter org.acegisecurity.vote.RoleVoter, the default value is ROLE_. It can be overwritten with an empty string if no prefix is wanted/neccessary at all. Please NOTE that AndroMDA will add this prefix to all role/actor names, which do not already have it defined in the model.

property.name: acegiAuthenticationManager
property.documentation: The bean name of the acegi authentication manager (defined in a seperate applicationContext outside of the generated one).

property.name: acegiRunAsManager
property.documentation: The bean name of the acegi run as manager (defined in a seperate applicationContext outside of the generated one).

propertyGroup.name: Rich Client
propertyGroup.documentation: Configures code generation when developing in a Rich Client environment.

property.name: richClient
property.documentation: Set to "true" if the cartridge is generating code for a rich client environment.

property.name: configPropertyPrefix
property.documentation: A prefix to use for properties stored in configuration files. A typical setting for this is the application ID plus the "." character. Empty by default.

property.name: applicationContextServerAuthentication
property.documentation: The name of the bean definition file used for server side declarations of user authentication beans when AcegiSecurity is being used (i.e. acegiServiceSecurity is true).

property.name: applicationContextClientAuthentication
property.documentation: The name of the bean definition file used for client side declarations of user authentication beans when AcegiSecurity is being used (i.e. acegiServiceSecurity is true).

property.name: serverTestBeanRefFactory
property.documentation: The name of the bean ref factory resource file used for unit testing the server code (i.e. application-test.xml)

property.name: serverTestContextDataSource
property.documentation: The name of the configuration file for the data source of the server test code (i.e. application-test-dataSource.xml)

property.name: serverTestContextAuthentication
property.documentation: The name of the bean definition file used for server side declarations of user authentication beans when AcegiSecurity is being used and unit tests are being performed.

property.name: clientHttpInvokerExecutor
property.documentation: The name of the class to use if a specialized HttpInvokerExecutor is desired on the client side when HttpInvoker is used as the remote service protocol. One common use it to use org.acegisecurity.context.httpinvoker.AuthenticationSimpleHttpInvokerRequestExecutor when remote services are protected with Basic Authentication using Acegi security. Another use is to set this to org.springframework.remoting.httpinvoker.CommonsHttpInvokerRequestExecutor if you want to use Jakarta Commons HttpClient to execute requests.

property.name: acegiAuthenticationManagerImplClass
property.documentation: The class of the authentication manager bean named with the aceciAuthenticationManager namespace property. If defined, an implementation definition will be added to the server side Spring configuration file named with the applicationContextServerAuthentication namespace property.

property.name: acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderBeanName
property.documentation: The bean name of the acegi authentication Dao Provider used by the server side authentication manager implemented with the acegiAuthenticationManagerImplClass namespace property.

property.name: acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderImplClass
property.documentation: The class of the Dao Authentication Provider bean named with the acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderBeanName namespace property. If defined, an implementation definition will be added to the server side Spring configuration file named with the applicationContextServerAuthentication namespace property.

property.name: acegiAuthenticationDaoBeanName
property.documentation: The bean name of the acegi authentication Dao used by the default server side authentication implementation generated for rich client projects.

property.name: acegiAuthenticationDaoImplClass
property.documentation: The complete package name and class name of the class that implements user authentication. This property should be set if you want to manage user authentication yourself and you want AndroMDA to generate stub classes to get the process started.

property.name: acegiDaoUserCacheBeanName
property.documentation: The name of the bean that implements a cache for user information. If defined, it activate user caching in the Dao provider by setting the "userCache" property of the Dao provider defined with the acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderClass namespace property.

property.name: acegiDaoUserCacheImplClass
property.documentation: The name of the class used to implement user caching in the Dao provider. If defined, a user cache implementation will be added to the server side Spring configuration file named with the applicationContextServerAuthentication namespace property. If defined, you must also define the acegiUserCacheConfigLocation namespace property.

property.name: acegiUserCacheConfigLocation
property.documentation: The location of the EhCache configuration file used by the acegiDaoUserCacheImplClass. This name is used as the "configLocation" property in the configuration of the implementation of the acegiDaoUserCacheImplClass namespace property. You should also define the acegiUserCacheName namespace property so it matches the cache name of the cache to use that is defined in the EhCache configuration file. If "default" is used for this property, a "default implementation" will be generated in the server configuration outlet. The file will be named ehcache-server-authentication.xml.

property.name: acegiUserCacheName
property.documentation: The name of the cache configuration to use for caching user authentication information. This cache configuration should be found in the EhCache configuration file defined with the acegiUserCacheConfigLocation namespace property.

property.name: acegiPasswordEncoderBeanName
property.documentation: The name of the bean that implements a password encoder for user information. If defined, it activates user password encoding in the Dao provider by setting the "passwordEncoder" property of the Dao provider defined with the acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderClass namespace property.

property.name: acegiPasswordEncoderImplClass
property.documentation: The name of the class used to implement user password encoder in the Dao provider. If defined, a password encoder implementation will be added to the server side Spring configuration file named with the applicationContextServerAuthentication namespace property.

property.name: acegiPasswordSaltSourceBeanName
property.documentation: The name of the bean that implements a password encoder salt source for user information. If defined, it enhances user password encoding in the Dao provider by setting the "saltSource" property of the Dao provider defined with the acegiDaoAuthenticationProviderClass namespace property.

propertyGroup.name: Remoting
propertyGroup.documentation: Properties related to Spring remote services

property.name: serviceRemotingType
property.documentation:
Determines the type of remoting to be used for Spring services. Can any one of
none
rmi
httpinvoker
burlap
hessian
lingo
Please note that in order to use Lingo remoting, you need to use Spring 2.0.

property.name: serviceRemotePort
property.documentation: The port the exported services get published on.

property.name: serviceRemotePortJMS
property.documentation: This port will be used if you export services using Lingo remoting.

property.name: serviceRemoteContext
property.documentation: The context the exported services get published on.

property.name: serviceRemoteUrlPattern
property.documentation: The url pattern associated to exported services. i.e. "/services".

property.name: serviceRemoteServer
property.documentation: The remote server the Spring services get published on.

property.name: remoteHttpServiceScheme
property.documentation: The scheme for any HTTP remotable services (i.e. http or https).

property.name: remoteRmiServiceScheme
property.documentation: The scheme for any RMI remotable services.

property.name: remoteTcpServiceScheme
property.documentation: The scheme for any TCP remotable services.

property.name: remoteDispatcherServletName
property.documentation: The name to give the remote dispatcher servlet.

property.name: remoteWebApplicationContextName
property.documentation: The name to give the remote web application context class.

property.name: remoteServiceUsername
property.documentation: The optional username to use for authenticating to the remotable services.

property.name: remoteServicePassword
property.documentation: The optional password to use for authenticating to the remotable services.

property.name: remoteAuthenticatingHttpInvokerRequestExecutorName
property.documentation: The name to give the AuthenticatingHttpInvokerRequestExecutor class.
